Contents.Description:
This Cmdlet will assist with creating a new address pool range.  The support address pool Types are MAC Addresses (VMAC), Fibre Channel/FCoE World Wide Name (VWWN), Server Serial Number (VSN), and IPv4 address pools (IPv4).

When creating new address pool ranges, the Generated Range Type will allocate 1,048,576 MAC or WWN addresses, whereas it will allocate 46,656 Serial Numbers.

If you specify a Custom Range Type, you must specify a range of addresses no smaller than 128, and no more than 1,048,576 per range.

Custom Address Ranges must adhere to the following format rules:

    * The MAC Address must be IEEE Compliant, and the format must be XH:XX:XX:XX:XX:XX, where H must be 0, 2, 4, 6, 8, A, C or E.

    Example:  12:22:33:44:55:00

    * The WWN Address must be IEEE compliant, and the format must be 10:00:XH:XX:XX:XX:XX:XX, where H must be 0, 2, 4, 6, 8, A, C or E.

    Example:  10:00:6C:9F:06:B0:00:00

    * The Serial Number addresses must start with VCU, and cannot contain more than 10 characters total.

    Example:  VCU1234567

IPv4 Address Subnets do not support Auto Generated, as the RangeType parameter is not required.  When creating a new IPv4 Address Subnet, you must provide a unique Name, Subnet Mask (CIDR [e.g. 24] or IPv4 Address Value [e.g. 255.255.255.0]), Start and End IPv4 Address, Gateway and Domain Name.  DNS Servers are optional.  To add more Address Ranges to a Subnet after creating it, please use the New-OVAddressPoolRange Cmdlet.

Parameters.Name: IPSubnet
Parameters.Description:
[Aliases -IPv4Subnet] 

The IPv4 Subnet that the new IPv4 Range will be assigned to.  Start and End values must be within the Network ID and Subnet value of the IPv4 Address Subnet Pool.

Parameters.Name: PoolType
Parameters.Description:
Specify the Pool Type the new Range will be assinged to.  Accepted values are:

    * VMAC
    * VWWN
    * VSN

Parameters.Name: RangeType
Parameters.Description:
The type of Address Range to create (not applicable for IPv4 address pools/Subnets).  Accepted values are:

    * Generated
    * Custom

Parameters.Name: Name
Parameters.Description: Provide the IPv4address pool range Name.

Parameters.Name: Start
Parameters.Description: The starting address in the range.  Cannot overlap with other address ranges, and should be unique within the datacenter/infrastructure.

Parameters.Name: End
Parameters.Description: The ending address in the range.  Cannot overlap with other address ranges, and should be unique within the datacenter/infrastructure.

Parameters.Name: ApplianceConnection
Parameters.Description:
Specify one or more [HPEOneView.Appliance.Connection] object(s) or Name property value(s). 

When attempting to create a new IPv4 address pool/Subnet, only a single HPEOneView.Appliance.Connection object or Name property value is allowed.  If Resource object is provided via Pipeline, the ApplianceConnection property of the object will be used.

InputTypes.Text: IPv4 Address Subnet resource object from Get-OVAddressPoolSubnet

ReturnValues.Text: Newly created and assigned address pool range resource object

Examples.Title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
Examples.Description: Create a new Appliance generated VMAC Pool Range.

Examples.Title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 2 --------------------------
Examples.Description: Create a new VWWN address pool range with the custom addresses, for the MyAppliance1.domain.com appliance connection.

Examples.Title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 3 --------------------------
Examples.Description: Create a new IPv4 address pool range, for the MyAppliance1.domain.com appliance connection.

Contents.Description:
This Cmdlet will assist with creating a new IPv4 address pool.  When creating a new IPv4 Address Subnet, you must provide the Network ID, Subnet Mask (CIDR [e.g. 24] or IPv4 Address Value [e.g. 255.255.255.0]), Gateway and Domain Name.  DNS Servers are optional.
    
To add IPv4 Address Ranges to a Subnet after creating it, please use the New-OVAddressPoolRange Cmdlet.

Parameters.Name: NetworkId
Parameters.Description: The IPv4 Network ID value of the subnet.

Parameters.Name: SubnetMask
Parameters.Description: CIDR [e.g. 24] or IPv4 Address Value [e.g. 255.255.255.0]

Parameters.Name: Gateway
Parameters.Description: IPv4 Address of the default gateway for the subnet.

Parameters.Name: Domain
Parameters.Description: DNS Domain Name of the subnet.

Parameters.Name: DNSServers
Parameters.Description: An array of DNS Server IPv4 Addresses.

Parameters.Name: ApplianceConnection
Parameters.Description: Specify one or more [HPEOneView.Appliance.Connection] object(s) or Name property value(s).

InputTypes.Value: None.  You cannot pipe objects to this Cmdlet.

ReturnValues.Text: Newly created IPv4 Address Subnet

Examples.Title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
Examples.Description: Create a new IPv4 address pool with the specified values.

Contents.Description: This Cmdlet will create the CSR for an given appliance, to then be submitted to a CA.

Parameters.Name: Country
Parameters.Description: The country code in either Full English or ISO3166-2 two-character format, is a required entry and must contain only two letters.

Parameters.Name: State
Parameters.Description: The state or province is a required entry, can contain up to 128 characters.

Parameters.Name: City
Parameters.Description: The city or locality is a required entry, can contain up to 128 characters.

Parameters.Name: Organization
Parameters.Description: The organization name is a required entry, can contain up to 64 characters.

Parameters.Name: CommonName
Parameters.Description:
The common name is a required entry, and can be FQDN/hostname or IPv4/IPv6 address. 

Example: "hpov.example.com"

Parameters.Name: OrganizationalUnit
Parameters.Description: The entry for the organizational unit name, may not exceed 64 characters.

Parameters.Name: AlternativeName
Parameters.Description:
An optional entry containing additional names that apply to the owner of the certificate, possibly including additional e-mail addresses, DNS names, IP addresses and other identifiers. 

Example: "hpov.example.com,hpov,192.168.1.1"

Parameters.Name: ContactName
Parameters.Description: The name of the contact person, may not exceed 64 characters.

Parameters.Name: Email
Parameters.Description: The contact person"s email address, which may not exceed 128 characters and is of the format name@domain.

Parameters.Name: Surname
Parameters.Description: The contact person"s family name, which may not exceed 64 characters.

Parameters.Name: GivenName
Parameters.Description: The contact person"s first name, which may not exceed 64 characters.

Parameters.Name: Initials
Parameters.Description: The contact person"s initials, which may not exceed 20 characters.

Parameters.Name: DNQualifier
Parameters.Description: The distinguished name qualifier, which further identifies the certificate recipient, which may not exceed 128 characters.

Parameters.Name: ChallengePassword
Parameters.Description: The challenge password is a required entry and must contain a minimum of 8 characters.  If you wish to be prompted to supply the password, use an asterisk (*) character.

Parameters.Name: UnstructuredName
Parameters.Description: Defined by the certificate authority, and may contain up to 64 characters.  Consult the certificate authority"s administrator or documentation for more information.

Parameters.Name: CnsaCompliantRequest
Parameters.Description: Specify to create a CNSA compliant certificate request.  By default the certificate request will create a 2048bit key length, while CNSA compliant will create a 3072bit key length.

Parameters.Name: ApplianceConnection
Parameters.Description: Specify one HPEOneView.Appliance.Connection object or Name property value.

InputTypes.Value: None.  You cannot pipe objects to this Cmdlet.

ReturnValues.Text: Object that contains the base64data property, which can then be written to a file or submitted to CA

Examples.Title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
Examples.Description: Create a CSR request to submit to CA.

Contents.Synopsis: Generate a new HPE Synergy Composer appliance encryption key.
Contents.Description:
HPE OneView encrypts sensitive data, such as managed device credentials, when it is stored on-disk in the appliance. The HPE OneView appliance encryption key (AEK) is used internally to encrypt the credentials for managed devices (such as, iLO, onboard administrator, frame link module). By default, the AEK is stored on the HPE Synergy Composer disk and also included in the appliance backup. This could pose a security risk in case the disk is stolen.

The secure data-at-rest option, when enabled, stores the AEK off-disk in Composer NVRAM, and does not include the key in the appliance backup. Enabling this option requires the administrator to save a copy of the AEK (recovery AEK) for use in the following circumstances:

* When restoring a backup taken when a different AEK was in effect.
* To successfully boot the system in the unlikely event that the system copy of the key is corrupted.
* A backup is being restored to a different new Composer or to the same Composer that has been factory reset.

The administrator must store the recovery AEK in a secure location, where it can be only accessed by authorized personnel. In the rare circumstance where the key cannot be read from the Composer NVRAM or the key gets corrupted, the administrator must use the appliance maintenance console to upload the AEK recovery copy, based on the error resolution message displayed. In the rare circumstance where the Composer NVRAM itself becomes inaccessible, users can choose to disable secure-data-at-rest option until the hardware issue itself is resolved.

If the downloaded recovery key and the AEK stored in the Composer NVRAM are both lost, the appliance data cannot be recovered.

This Cmdlet will generate a new encryption key, if the existing encryption key is lost or unknown.  Any existing backups that were created with the prior encryption key will become invalid.  After creating a new encryption key, it is highly recommended to create a new backup using New-OVBackup and save it, along with the new encryption key file that can be generated by this Cmdlet by using the -Location parameter, to a secure and safe location.  This Cmdlet can only be used when data at rest encryption has been enabled.

Parameters.Name: ApplianceConnection
Parameters.Description: Specify one or more [HPEOneView.Appliance.Connection] object(s) or Name property value(s).

Parameters.Name: Location
Parameters.Description: Specify the location where to save the generated encryption key file to.

InputTypes.Value: None.  You cannot pipe objects to this Cmdlet.

ReturnValues.Text: The newly created file if the -Location paramter is provided.

Examples.Title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
Examples.Description: Generate a new appliance encryption key, using the current working directory.

Examples.Title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 2 --------------------------
Examples.Description: Generate a new appliance encryption key, save the created file to a specific location.

Contents.Synopsis: Create a new appliance self signed Certificate.
Contents.Description: Use thid Cmdlet to create or recreate a self signed Certificate for the appliance.

Parameters.Name: Country
Parameters.Description: The country code in either Full English or ISO3166-2 two-character format, is a required entry and must contain only two letters.

Parameters.Name: State
Parameters.Description: The state or province is a required entry, can contain up to 128 characters.

Parameters.Name: City
Parameters.Description: The city or locality is a required entry, can contain up to 128 characters.

Parameters.Name: Organization
Parameters.Description: The organization name is a required entry, can contain up to 64 characters.

Parameters.Name: CommonName
Parameters.Description:
The common name is a required entry, and can be FQDN/hostname or IPv4/IPv6 address. 

Example: "hpov.example.com"

Parameters.Name: OrganizationalUnit
Parameters.Description: The entry for the organizational unit name, may not exceed 64 characters.

Parameters.Name: AlternativeName
Parameters.Description:
An optional entry containing additional names that apply to the owner of the certificate, possibly including additional e-mail addresses, DNS names, IP addresses and other identifiers. 

Example: "hpov.example.com,hpov,192.168.1.1"

Parameters.Name: ContactName
Parameters.Description: The name of the contact person, may not exceed 64 characters.

Parameters.Name: Email
Parameters.Description: The contact person"s email address, which may not exceed 128 characters and is of the format name@domain.

Parameters.Name: Surname
Parameters.Description: The contact person"s family name, which may not exceed 64 characters.

Parameters.Name: GivenName
Parameters.Description: The contact person"s first name, which may not exceed 64 characters.

Parameters.Name: Initials
Parameters.Description: The contact person"s initials, which may not exceed 20 characters.

Parameters.Name: DNQualifier
Parameters.Description: The distinguished name qualifier, which further identifies the certificate recipient, which may not exceed 128 characters.

Parameters.Name: ApplianceConnection
Parameters.Description: Specify one HPEOneView.Appliance.Connection object or Name property value.

InputTypes.Value: None.  You cannot pipe objects to this Cmdlet.

ReturnValues.Text: Object that contains the "base64data" property of the certificate

Examples.Title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
Examples.Description: Generate self signed Certificate for the appliance.

Contents.Synopsis: Create a new appliance SNMP trap destiation.
Contents.Description:
HPE OneView can be used as a proxy to forward device traps from servers and enclosures (OA) to other SNMP-enabled applications on the network. HPE OneView can forward traps, as SNMPv3 or SNMPv1 traps, to configured destinations.

Appliance SNMP settings allow you to add destinations to which the traps need to be forwarded. You can configure each destination as an SNMPv1 or SNMPv3 destination, depending on whether the traps are sent in SNMPv1 or SNMPv3 formats. 

Additionally, if you have Gen6 or Gen7 servers being monitored by HPE OneView in your environment, you can configure the read community string that HPE OneView uses for monitoring these servers with SNMPv1. 

Minimum required privileges: Infrastructure administrator

Parameters.Name: ApplianceConnection
Parameters.Description: Specify one or more [HPEOneView.Appliance.Connection] object(s) or Name property value(s).

Parameters.Name: CommunityString
Parameters.Description: SNMPv1 trap community string.

Parameters.Name: Destination
Parameters.Description: IP Address or Hostname of the target SNMP trap reciever.

Parameters.Name: Port
Parameters.Description: Specify the alternate SNMP destination port.

Parameters.Name: SnmpV3User
Parameters.Description: The defined SNMPv3 user created on the appliance with Get-OVSnmpV3User.

Parameters.Name: Type
Parameters.Description:
SNMP version type.  Allowed values:

    * SNMPv1
    * SNMPv3

InputTypes.Value: None.  You cannot pipe objects to this Cmdlet.

ReturnValues.Text: The configured SNMPv1 Trap Destination on the appliance.
The configured SNMPv3 Trap Destination on the appliance.

Examples.Title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
Examples.Description: Create a new SNMPv1 trap destination on the appliance.

Examples.Title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 2 --------------------------
Examples.Code:
$SnmpV3Password = ConvertTo-SecureString -String $CommonPassword -AsPlainText -Force
$Snmpv3User = New-OVSnmpV3User -ApplianceSnmpUser -Username Tr@pUser -SecurityLevel AuthAndPriv -AuthProtocol SHA512 -AuthPassword $SnmpV3Password -PrivProtocol AES192 -PrivPassword $SnmpV3Password
New-OVApplianceTrapDestination -Type SnmpV3 -SnmpV3User $CreatedSnmpSnmpv3UserV3User -Destination monitor1.contoso.com
Examples.Description: Define a new SNMPv3 user, and associate it with the new SNMPv3 trap destination on the appliance.

Contents.Synopsis: Generate and download or remote save appliance backup.
Contents.Description:
HPE OneView provides the ability to save your configuration settings and management data to a backup file and enables you to use that backup to restore a corrupted appliance in the event of a catastrophic failure.

The backup process involves creating a backup file and then downloading that file so that you can store it to a safe and secure (off-appliance) location for future use. You can schedule automatic backup operations and designate a remote location for the backup file.

Use this Cmdlet to generate and download an appliance configuration backup file for backup purposes.  The backup file does not contain user account passwords.  The backup file is not meant to restore to other appliance for quick provisioning, as it is an encrypted TAR GZIP file.

If an automatic backup policy is configured on the appliance, the Cmdlet is instruct the appliance to offload the newly created backup to the remote location.  If you wish to download the backup, use the -Location and -Force parameters, which will initiate a download to the value provided.

Parameters.Name: Location
Parameters.Description: The full path to where the Support Dump will be saved to.  The downloaded file name will be generated by the appliance.  If the directory does not exist, it will be created. By default will use current directory.

Parameters.Name: Force
Parameters.Description: The Cmdlet will validate if the appliance is configured to save backup files to a remote location.  Use this option to force download the backup file instead of copying to the remote location.

Parameters.Name: Async
Parameters.Description: Use this parameter to immediately return the async task.  By default, the Cmdlet will wait for the task to complete.

Parameters.Name: ApplianceConnection
Parameters.Description: Specify one or more [HPEOneView.Appliance.Connection] object(s) or Name property value(s).

InputTypes.Value: None.  You cannot pipe objects to this Cmdlet.

ReturnValues.Value: The generated backup File if appliance is not setup for remote storage or the Force parameter is used.

ReturnValues.Text: Async task to create the backup file.

Examples.Title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
Examples.Description: This command will generate a new backup, and if a remote location is configured, will initiate the file transfer.  If not configured, then the Cmdlet will download the file to the current working directory.

Examples.Title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 2 --------------------------
Examples.Description: This command will save the Appliance backup file to C:\Temp

Contents.Synopsis: Create a new cluster profile resource.
Contents.Description:
A cluster profile enables you to deploy and manage a cluster of servers (nodes) managed by HPE OneView and orchestrates consistent configuration on cluster of server nodes to share the same workload.  A cluster profile and the associated server profile template are used to define a consistent configuration from server nodes to members in the cluster. The associated server profiles define physical server configurations for server nodes in the cluster, which are derived from parent cluster profile and its associated server profile template. 

NOTE: The server profile template must have a configured connection to the hypervisor management network for the template to be valid for use by a hypervisor cluster profile.

The cluster profile helps you manage life cycle operations, such as growing or shrinking the cluster, modifying configurations based on needs, consistency checks, and nondisruptive firmware updates on the member nodes. For example, you can grow or shrink a cluster by adding or removing members from the cluster profile. Any change in the configuration of the cluster profile will be reported as an inconsistency. When inconsistencies are remediated, the changed configurations can be applied on cluster and member nodes.

A cluster profile can manage VMware ESXi-based hypervisor clusters by leveraging VMware vCenter server. A hypervisor cluster must be managed by one instance of HPE OneView to avoid inconsistencies.

Use this Cmdlet to create a new cluster profile within OneView.  Any new created clusters within OneView cannot be removed from OneView withour destroying the cluster within the cluster manager.

Minimum required privileges: Infrastructure administrator, Server administrator, Server profile architect, or Server profile administrator.

Parameters.Name: ApplianceConnection
Parameters.Description: Specify one or more [HPEOneView.Appliance.Connection] object(s) or Name property value(s).

Parameters.Name: Async
Parameters.Description: Use this parameter to immediately return the async task.  By default, the Cmdlet will wait for the task to complete.

Parameters.Name: ClusterManager
Parameters.Description: Specify the cluster manager that will manage the cluster and associated members, from Get-OVClusterManager.

Parameters.Name: ClusterManagerLocation
Parameters.Description: Specify the location where the cluster will be created within the cluster manager.

Parameters.Name: ClusterPrefix
Parameters.Description: Specify the cluster member hostname prefix that will be used.  A unique numerical value will be appended to the end.  If omitted, the clsuter name will be used as the prefix.

Parameters.Name: DRSEnabled
Parameters.Description: Specify if DRS (if supported) should be enabled ($True) or disabled ($false).

Parameters.Name: Description
Parameters.Description: Provide a description of the cluster.

Parameters.Name: DistributedSwitchUsage
Parameters.Description:
If overriding the distributed virtual switch configuring set by the cluster manager, specify the switch usage.  Allowed values:

    * Standard
    * Distributed

Parameters.Name: DistributedSwitchVersion
Parameters.Description: If overriding the distributed virtual switch configuring set by the cluster manager, specify the version.  To identify the supported versions, look at the AvailableDvsVersions property of the returned cluster manager from Get-OVClusterManager.

Parameters.Name: HAEnabled
Parameters.Description: Specify if VMware HA (if supported) should be enabled ($True) or disabled ($false).

Parameters.Name: MultiNicVMotionEnabled
Parameters.Description: Specify if multi-NIC VMotion (if supported) should be enabled ($True) or disabled ($false).

Parameters.Name: Name
Parameters.Description: Provide the cluster profile name.  If -Prefix is omitted, this value will become the cluster node prefix value.

Parameters.Name: Scope
Parameters.Description: Provide an HPEOneView.Appliance.ScopeCollection resource object to initially associate with.  Resource can also be added to scope using the Add-OVResourceToScope Cmdlet.

Parameters.Name: ServerProfileTemplate
Parameters.Description: The server profile template from Get-OVServerProfileTemplate that the cluster configuration will be derived from and follow cluster consistency with.

Parameters.Name: StorageVolume
Parameters.Description: One or more storage volumes to assign.

Parameters.Name: UnmanageVSwitch
Parameters.Description: Use to configure the cluster profile to not manage host networking.

Parameters.Name: VirtualSwitchType
Parameters.Description:
Use to indicate which vSiwtch type to configure when overriding cluster manager networking settings.  Allowed values are:

    * Standard
    * Distributed

Parameters.Name: ClusterPassword
Parameters.Description: Specify the cluster administrator/root account password.

Parameters.Name: ConfigurePortGroups
Parameters.Description: Specify if port groups should also be configured when configuring host networking.

Parameters.Name: Domain
Parameters.Description: Optional - When deploying a new cluster profile with HPE Synergy and Image Streamer, specify the domain name if the management network is not configured to use an IP address pool.

Parameters.Name: Gateway
Parameters.Description: When deploying a new cluster profile with HPE Synergy and Image Streamer, specify the gateway if the management network is not configured to use an IP address pool.

Parameters.Name: LeaveHostsInMaintenanceMode
Parameters.Description: Specify if the host should be left in maintenance mode (if applicable) before servicing the cluster.

Parameters.Name: OverrideClusterManagerConfig
Parameters.Description: Use to indicate the desire to override the cluster manager default settings.

Parameters.Name: OverrideManagementAddressAssignmet
Parameters.Description: Use to indicate address assignment.  If the server profile template boot connections are set to require static addresses, the IPAddress value must be used in the New-OVClusterProfileMember Cmdlet.

Parameters.Name: OverrideNetworkingConfig
Parameters.Description: Use to indicate if network naming will be overridden.

Parameters.Name: PortGroupNameOverride
PrimaryDNS
Parameters.Description: Optional - When deploying a new cluster profile with HPE Synergy and Image Streamer, specify the primary DNS if the management network is not configured to use an IP address pool.

Parameters.Name: SecondaryDNS
Parameters.Description: Optional - When deploying a new cluster profile with HPE Synergy and Image Streamer, specify the secondary DNS if the management network is not configured to use an IP address pool.

Parameters.Name: Servers
Parameters.Description: One or more server resource objects from New-OVClusterProfileMember.  Value can be empty to create an empty cluster, if the target cluster manager supports that type of configuration, like VMware vSphere.

Parameters.Name: StorageVolumeFileSystem
Parameters.Description:
Specify if the storage volume(s) in the StorageVolume parameter should be formatted with a specific filesystem.  Allowed values:

    * VMFS
    * Unmanaged

Parameters.Name: SubnetMask
Parameters.Description: When deploying a new cluster profile with HPE Synergy and Image Streamer, specify the subnet mask if the management network is not configured to use an IP address pool.

Parameters.Name: TertiaryDNS
Parameters.Description: Optional - When deploying a new cluster profile with HPE Synergy and Image Streamer, specify the tertiary DNS if the management network is not configured to use an IP address pool.

Parameters.Name: VSwitchNameOverride
UseIPAddressAsHostName
Parameters.Description: Use to indicate if the IP Address allocated or assigned should be used for the cluster manager registration instead of the hostname or FQDN.

InputTypes.Value: None.  You cannot pipe objects to this Cmdlet.

ReturnValues.Text: Asynchronous task resource to monitor.

Examples.Title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
Examples.Code:
# Get the specific Cluster Manager
$ClusterManager = Get-OVHypervisorManager -Name ClusterManager1

# Display the allowed locations to place the cluster
$ClusterManager.Locations

DC1
DC2
DC3
DC3\Folder1

$ClusterPassword = Read-Host -Prompt "Cluster password" -AsSecureString

# Get the server profile template the cluster will be created and derived from
$ServerProfileTemplate = Get-OVServerProfileTemplate -Name "Hypervisor Cluster Prod"

# Get a list of servers based on the SPT, that are available to deploy to
$Servers = Get-OVServer -NoProfile -InputObject $ServerProfileTemplate -Count 4

# Create the new cluster profile
New-OVClusterProfile -Name ProdCluster1 -ClusterPrefix ProdClusterNode- -ClusterManager $ClusterManager -ClusterManagerLocation "DC2" -ServerProfileTemplate $ServerProfileTemplate -ClusterPassword $ClusterPassword -Servers $Servers
Examples.Description: Create a new cluster profile.

Examples.Title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 2 --------------------------
Examples.Code:
# Get the specific Cluster Manager
$ClusterManager = Get-OVHypervisorManager -Name ClusterManager1

# Display the allowed distributed switch versions supported by the cluster manager
$ClusterManager.AvailableDvsVersions

4.0
4.10
5.0.0
5.1.0
5.5.0
6.0
6.7

$ClusterPassword = Read-Host -Prompt "Cluster password" -AsSecureString

# Get the server profile template the cluster will be created and derived from
$ServerProfileTemplate = Get-OVServerProfileTemplate -Name "Hypervisor Cluster Prod"

# Get a list of servers based on the SPT, that are available to deploy to
$Servers = Get-OVServer -NoProfile -InputObject $ServerProfileTemplate -Count 4

# Create new cluster profile overriding the cluster manager settings
New-OVClusterProfile -Name ProdCluster1 -ClusterPrefix ProdClusterNode- -ClusterManager $ClusterManager -ClusterManagerLocation "DC2" -ServerProfileTemplate $ServerProfileTemplate -ClusterPassword $ClusterPassword -Servers $Servers -OverrideClusterManagerConfig -VirtualSwitchType Distributed -DistributedSwitchUsage AllNetworks -DistributedSwitchVersion 6.0 -HAEnabled $true -DRSEnabled $false
Examples.Description: Create a new cluster profile, overriding clsuter manager settings.

Contents.Synopsis: Helper Cmdlet to create proper add host request for New-OVClusterProfile.
Contents.Description:
This is a helper Cmdlet to create a valid resourc object New-OVClusterProfile will then use for the -Servers parameter.

Minimum required privileges: Infrastructure administrator, Server administrator, Server profile architect, or Server profile administrator.

Parameters.Name: IPv4Address
Parameters.Description: A valid IPv4 Address for the hypervisor host management interface.

Parameters.Name: InputObject
Parameters.Description: A server hardware resource

Parameters.Name: OSDeploymentAttributes
Parameters.Description: Configured OS Deployment Plan parameters from Get-OVOSDeploymentPlanAttribute.  Only applicable for HPE Synergy Image Streamer deployment.

ReturnValues.Text: Properly formatted object for New-OVClusterProfile.

Examples.Title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
Examples.Description: Create a basic add host object for New-OVClusterProfile.

Examples.Title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 2 --------------------------
Examples.Description: Create anadd host object for New-OVClusterProfile and specify its managmenet IP Address if the associated Server Profile Template management network is not associated with an IP address pool.

Examples.Title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 3 --------------------------
Examples.Code:
$MyDeploymentPlan = Get-OVOSDeploymentPlan -Name "vSphere 6.5 U3 Corp Standard" -ErrorAction Stop
$OSDeploymentAttributes = Get-OVOSDeploymentPlanAttributes -InputObject $MyDeploymentPlan
($OSDeploymentAttributes | Where-Object name -eq "CustomAttribute1").value = "MySpecialValue"
$Server = Get-OVServer -Name "Encl1, Bay 1"
New-OVClusterProfileMember -InputObject $Server -IPAddress 192.168.10.1 -OSDeploymentParameter $OSDeploymentAttributes

Contents.Synopsis: Create Custom Baseline from Hotfixes and Source Baseline.
Contents.Description: HPE ProLiant Hotfixes are released out of the main SPP release cycle.  Administrators can use HPSUM external to HPE OneView to create a custom baseline, but then need to upload to the appliance.  Hotfixes can be directly uploaded to an HPE OneView 2.0 Appliance, with the ability to create a Custom Baseline by using a source Baseline (which must exist in the Baseline Repository) and specified Hotfix(s).

Parameters.Name: SourceBaseline
Parameters.Description: An existing Baseline within the HPE OneView Baseline Repository.

Parameters.Name: Hotfixes
Parameters.Description:
Array of Hotfix filenames, or Component name.  
    
Example: @(cp111111.exe,cp222222.scexe,cp333333.exe,cp444444.scexe)

Parameters.Name: BaselineName
Parameters.Description:
The final custom Baseline name.

Example: custom_SPPGen9Snap3_2015_0327_82

Parameters.Name: Async
Parameters.Description: Use this parameter to immediately return the async task.  By default, the Cmdlet will wait for the task to complete.

Parameters.Name: ApplianceConnection
Parameters.Description: Specify one HPEOneView.Appliance.Connection object or Name property value. If Resource object is provided via Pipeline, the ApplianceConnection property of the object will be used.

Parameters.Name: Scope
Parameters.Description: Provide an HPEOneView.Appliance.ScopeCollection resource object to initially associate with.  Resource can also be added to scope using the Add-OVResourceToScope Cmdlet.

InputTypes.Text: Source HPE OneView Baseline from Get-OVBaseline

ReturnValues.Text: Asynchronous task object to monitor.

Examples.Title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
Examples.Description: Upload hotfixes to appliance, then create a new custom baseline from the "MyBaseline" baseline.

Contents.Synopsis: Get a member device from a defined Rack.
Description:
A data center represents a physically contiguous area in which racks containing IT equipment are located.
For example, you have IT equipment in two rooms or on separate floors. You could create a data center for each of these areas.
Each server, enclosure, or power distribution device in your data center can report its power requirements, but it can be difficult to understand the power and cooling requirements for your data center as a whole. The appliance enables you to bring power and cooling management of your servers, enclosures, and power delivery devices together in a single management system.
When you initialize the appliance for the first time, it creates a data center named Datacenter 1. The appliance provides this data center as a place to visualize your racks. You can rename or edit this data center to match the values and layout of your data center, you can use it as the basis for a planned data center model, or you can delete this data center without adverse effects.

This Cmdlet will create a new datacenter.  You will need to specify the Name and dimensions.  Optionally, you can override the default Electrical Derating, default voltage, local currency (which will aid in power calculation costs) and power cooling capacity.  Remote Support settings can only be set when Remote Support has been enabled and configured on the appliance.  If omitting Remote Support location settings, then the datacenter will default to the default location set.

Parameters.Name: Name
Parameters.Description: A name to identify the data center. Must not exceed 255 characters; no leading spaces.

Parameters.Name: Width
Parameters.Description: Width of the datacenter, in (US) Feet.  Maximum of 50 meters (164.042 feet).  Millimeters can be used, which requires the -Millimeters switch parameter.

Parameters.Name: Depth
Parameters.Description: Depth of the datacenter, in (US) Feet.  Maximum of 50 meters (164.042 feet).  Millimeters can be used, which requires the -Millimeters switch parameter.

Parameters.Name: Millimeters
Parameters.Description: If specifying millimeter value for Width and Depth, this parameter is required.

Parameters.Name: ElectricalDerating
Parameters.Description:
If Custom ElectricalDetratingType is set to Custom, specify a value between 20-100%.

Default: 20%

Parameters.Name: ElectricalDeratingType
Parameters.Description:
The percentage below the rated maximum power dissipation at which the devices are operated, accounting for case/body temperature, ambient temperature, and type of cooling.

You can specify a derating percentage by choosing Custom, or you can choose not to apply derating to the rated maximum power dissipation by specifying None.

Default: NA/Jp

Parameters.Name: DefaultVoltage
Parameters.Description:
The default power line voltage for the data center.

Default: 220

Parameters.Name: Currency
Parameters.Description: The currency unit for energy costs.

Parameters.Name: PowerCosts
Parameters.Description: The energy cost per kWh, specified by the Currency.

Parameters.Name: CoolingCapacity
Parameters.Description: The maximum cooling capacity for the data center, in KW. The appliance analyzes heat generation using this value.

Parameters.Name: CoolingMultiplier
Parameters.Description:
The ratio of cooling cost to power cost for the data center.

This value represents the relative cost of cooling the system compared to the cost of powering the system. The default value of 1.5 indicates that it costs 1.5 times as much to cool the system as it does to power the system.

Default:  1.5

Parameters.Name: PrimaryContact
Parameters.Description: Primary Remote Support Contact object from Get-OVRemoteSupportContact defined on the appliance.

Parameters.Name: SecondaryContact
Parameters.Description: Secondary Remote Support Contact object from Get-OVRemoteSupportContact defined on the appliance.  Must not be the same value as the Primary Contact.

Parameters.Name: Address1
Parameters.Description: Address of datacenter.

Parameters.Name: Address2
Parameters.Description: Optional address line.

Parameters.Name: City
Parameters.Description: City of residence for the datacenter.

Parameters.Name: State
Parameters.Description: State/province of residence for the datacenter.

Parameters.Name: PostCode
Parameters.Description: Postal code for the datacenter.

Parameters.Name: Country
Parameters.Description: Country of residence for the datacenter.

Parameters.Name: TimeZone
Parameters.Description: Time Zone of residence for the datacenter.

Parameters.Name: ApplianceConnection
Parameters.Description: Specify one or more [HPEOneView.Appliance.Connection] object(s) or Name property value(s).

InputTypes.Value: None.  You cannot pipe objects to this Cmdlet.

ReturnValues.Text: Newly created datacenter.

Examples.Title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
Examples.Description: Create new "LA DC 12" datacenter.

Examples.Title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 2 --------------------------
Examples.Description: Create a new datacenter with Remote Support settings.

Contents.Description:
An enclosure group is a logical resource that defines a standard configuration for member logical enclosures. The network connectivity for an enclosure group is defined by the logical interconnect groups associated with the enclosure group. When configuring an HPE Synergy enclosure group, it may contain up to five enclosures.  When configuring an HPE BladeSystem C-Class enclosure group, it will only contain a single enclosure.

Enclosure groups and logical interconnect groups

    * A logical interconnect group that is assigned to a bay within an enclosure group must have that bay populated within the logical interconnect group.
    * All populated bays in a logical interconnect group must be assigned to the enclosure group. For example, a logical interconnect group that has bays 1 and 2 populated must be assigned to bays 1 and 2 of the enclosure group in order for the enclosure group to be created.
    * An enclosure group can contain logical interconnect groups that are highly available, redundant, A-side only, or A-side and B-side. See About interconnect bay sets.
    * Synergy multiple-enclosure logical interconnect groups must have the proper bays populated in all enclosures in the interconnect link topology.
    * Synergy single-enclosure logical interconnect groups, such as a Serial Attached SCSI (SAS) logical interconnect group, can be applied to individual bays in individual enclosures in the interconnect link topology.

Parameters.Name: Name
Parameters.Description: A name for the new enclosure group.

Parameters.Name: EnclosureCount
Parameters.Description: Specify the number of Synergy Frames will participate within the Enclosure Group.

Parameters.Name: LogicalInterconnectGroupMapping
Parameters.Description:
An Enclosure Group can reference multiple Logical Interconnect Groups, once per Interconnect Bay.  If a Single Logical Interconnect Group object is provided (either via parameter variable or via Pipeline), the Logical Interconnect Group objects Logical Interconnect Bay configuration will be used.

To specify a specific C-Class Logical Interconnect Group(s) for one or more Interconnect Bays, use a Hashtable, with the Bay ID as the Key, and Logical Interconnect Group Name, URI or Object as the Value.  Example:

$LogicalInterConnectGroupMapping = @{ 1 = "MyLIg1"; 2 = "MyLig1"; 5 = "OtherLIG"; 6 = "OtherLIG"}

$MyLig1 = Get-OVLogicalInterconnectGroup -Name MyLig1
$OtherLIG = Get-OVLogicalInterconnectGroup OtherLIG
$LogicalInterConnectGroupMapping = @{ 1 = $MyLig1; 2 = $MyLig1; 5 = $OtherLIG; 6 = $OtherLIG"

When attempting to define a Syenrgy-based Enclosure Group, either an Array or Hashtable is allowed.  If an Array of Logical Interconnect Groups are provided, the Cmdlet will determine the Interconnect placement automatically. Example:

$MySynergyLig1 = Get-OVLogicalInterconnectGroup -Name MySynergyLig1
$LogicalInterConnectGroupMapping = $MySynergyLig1
#or
$MySynergyLig1 = Get-OVLogicalInterconnectGroup -Name MySynergyLig1
$MySynergyLig2 = Get-OVLogicalInterconnectGroup -Name MySynergyLig2
$LogicalInterConnectGroupMapping = $MySynergyLig1,$MySynergyLig2


Do know that SAS and VC FC LIGs are bound to a single frame, and will not reference other Frames if FrameCount is greater than 1.

Use a Hashtable to bind specific LIGs to specific Frames.  The Interconnect placement will be determined automatically based on either the Hashtable Key name "Frame#" (where # is the numerical value of the Frame) or Enclosure Index value (depending if a SAS or Synergy VC FC LIG).  Example:

$3FrameVCLIG = Get-OVLogicalInterconnectGroup -Name "My MultiFrame Synergy LIG 1"
$SasLIG = Get-OVLogicalInterconnectGroup -Name "My Synergy Sas LIG 1"
$LogicalInterconnectGroupMapping = @{Frame1 = $3FrameVCLIG,$SasLIG; Frame2 = $3FrameVCLIG,$SasLIG; Frame3 = $3FrameVCLIG }

Parameters.Name: PowerRedundantMode
Parameters.Description:
The Power Redundancy Mode to set when an Enclosure is added to the appliance.

Allowed Values:

    * RedundantPowerFeed - Provides N+N Power Redundancy Configuration
    * RedundantPowerSupply - Provided N+1 Power Redundancy Configuration

Parameters.Name: IPv4AddressType
Parameters.Description:
Use to specify how the IPv4 Addresses will be assigned to Synergy resources management interface(s).  Allowed values:

    * External -  The IPv4 address is managed externally, static assignment. 
    * DHCP -  The IPv4 address is assigned using DHCP. 
    * AddressPool - The IPv4 address is assigned from a pool of IP addresses specified by the AddressPool parameter, similar to HPE BladeSystem C-Class "Enclosure Bay IP Addressing" (aka EBIPA). 

Default: DHCP

Parameters.Name: IPv4AddressRange
Parameters.Description: The IPv4 address pool object from Get-OVAddressPoolRange.

Parameters.Name: IPv6AddressRange
Parameters.Description: The IPv6 address pool object from Get-OVAddressPoolRange.

Parameters.Name: IPv6AddressType
Parameters.Description:
Use to specify how the IPv6 Addresses will be assigned to Synergy resources management interface(s).  Allowed values:

    * External -  The IPv4 address is managed externally, static assignment. 
    * DHCP -  The IPv4 address is assigned using DHCP. 
    * AddressPool - The IPv4 address is assigned from a pool of IP addresses specified by the AddressPool parameter, similar to HPE BladeSystem C-Class "Enclosure Bay IP Addressing" (aka EBIPA). 

Default: None

Parameters.Name: DeploymentNetworkType
Parameters.Description:
Specify the Synergy Image Stream deployment network type.  Allowed values:

    * Internal - Deployment network is an internal, managed by the Frame links, which Logical Intercoonect Group must have an ImageStreamer Uplink Set.
    * External - Deployment network is connected to an External management switch.
    * None - No deployment network will be configured.

Default: None

Parameters.Name: DeploymentNetwork
Parameters.Description: The Ethernet Network with the purpose property set to Management.  Must also include DeploymentNetworkType parameter, value must be "External", with the Ethernet Network associated with a non-ImageStreamer Uplink Set.

Parameters.Name: ApplianceConnection
Parameters.Description:
Specify one HPEOneView.Appliance.Connection object or Name property value. If Resource object is provided via Pipeline, the ApplianceConnection property of the object will be used.

Default Value: ${Global:ConnectSessions} | ? Default

Parameters.Name: ImportFile
Parameters.Description: Provide the full path and file name of the JSON file.

Parameters.Name: Scope
Parameters.Description: Provide an HPEOneView.Appliance.ScopeCollection resource object to initially associate with.  Resource can also be added to scope using the Add-OVResourceToScope Cmdlet.

InputTypes.Text: Single Logical Interconnect Group resource object

ReturnValues.Text: The newly created enclosure group resource

Examples.Title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
Examples.Description: Get the "myLogicalInterconnectGroup" object and pass it to create the "MyGroup" Enclosure Group.

Examples.Title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 2 --------------------------
Examples.Code:
$Prodlig = Get-OVLogicalInterconnectGroup -name "Production LIG"
$DMZlig = Get-OVLogicalInterconnectGroup -name "DMZ LIG"
$ConfigurationScript = "#Configure Insight Remote Support CentralConnect
>>  ENABLE REMOTE_SUPPORT IRS 80.80.1.14 7906"
New-OVEnclosureGroup -name "Production Enclosure Group 1" -LogicalInterconnectGroupMapping @{1 = $Prodlig; 2 = $Prodlig; 5 = $DMZlig; 6 = $DMZlig} -ConfigurationScript $ConfigurationScript
Examples.Description: Get two different Logical Interconnect Groups, define an OA Configuration Script, then assign the LIGs to the specific Interconnect Bays for appliance "MyAppliance1.domain.com".

Examples.Title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 3 --------------------------
Examples.Description: Connect to the provided Onboard Administrator, detect the Interconnect Bay population to then create both a Logical Interconnect Group and associate it with the Enclosure Group being requested.

Examples.Title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 4 --------------------------
Examples.Code: New-OVEnclosureGroup -name "MyGroup" -DiscoverFromEnclosure -OAAddress MyOAIP.domain.com -Username Administrator -Password MyPassword -LigPrefix "My LIG Policy"
Examples.Description: Connect to the provided Onboard Administrator, detect the Interconnect Bay population to then create both a Logical Interconnect Group ("My LIG Policy") and associate it with the Enclosure Group being requested.

Examples.Title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 5 --------------------------
Examples.Code:
$MySynergyLig1 = Get-OVLogicalInterconnectGroup -Name MySynergyLig1
New-OVEnclosureGroup -name "My Synergy Enclosure Group 1" -LogicalInterconnectGroupMapping $MySynergyLig1 -EnclosureCount 3 -IPv4AddressType DHCP
Examples.Description: Create a 3-Frame Synergy Enclosure Group using a single Logical Interconnect Group.

Examples.Title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 6 --------------------------
Examples.Code:
$MySynergyLig1 = Get-OVLogicalInterconnectGroup -Name MySynergyLig1
New-OVEnclosureGroup -name "My Synergy Enclosure Group 1" -LogicalInterconnectGroupMapping @{Frame1 = $3FrameVCLIG,$SasLIG; Frame2 = $3FrameVCLIG,$SasLIG; Frame3 = $3FrameVCLIG } -EnclosureCount 3 -IPv4AddressType DHCP
Examples.Description: Create a 3-Frame Synergy Enclosure Group using multiple Logical Interconnect Groups specific to each Frame.

Examples.Title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 7 --------------------------
Examples.Code:
$AddressPool = Get-OVAddressPoolSubnet -NetworkId "10.140.51.0" -ErrorAction Stop | Get-OVAddressPoolRange
$MySynergyLig1 = Get-OVLogicalInterconnectGroup -Name MySynergyLig1
New-OVEnclosureGroup -name "My Synergy Enclosure Group 1" -LogicalInterconnectGroupMapping @{Frame1 = $3FrameVCLIG,$SasLIG; Frame2 = $3FrameVCLIG,$SasLIG; Frame3 = $3FrameVCLIG } -EnclosureCount 3 -IPv4AddressType AddressPool -AddressPool $AddressPool -DeploymentNetworkType Internal
Examples.Description: Create a 3-Frame Synergy Enclosure Group using multiple Logical Interconnect Groups specific to each Frame, with ImageStreamer support using a LIG with an ImageStreamer Uplink Set (aka Internal).

Examples.Title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 8 --------------------------
Examples.Code:
$AddressPool = Get-OVAddressPoolSubnet -NetworkId "10.140.51.0" -ErrorAction Stop | Get-OVAddressPoolRange
$DeploymentNetwork = Get-OVNetwork -Name "Deployment Network" -ErrorAction Stop
$MySynergyLig1 = Get-OVLogicalInterconnectGroup -Name MySynergyLig1
New-OVEnclosureGroup -name "My Synergy Enclosure Group 1" -LogicalInterconnectGroupMapping @{Frame1 = $3FrameVCLIG,$SasLIG; Frame2 = $3FrameVCLIG,$SasLIG; Frame3 = $3FrameVCLIG } -EnclosureCount 3 -IPv4AddressType AddressPool -AddressPool $AddressPool -DeploymentNetworkType External -DeploymentNetwork $DeploymentNetwork
Examples.Description: Create a 3-Frame Synergy Enclosure Group using multiple Logical Interconnect Groups specific to each Frame, with ImageStreamer support using a LIG without an ImageStreamer Uplink Set and specifying which Ethernet Network object is the deployment network (aka External).

Contents.Synopsis: Create a new external baseline repository.
Contents.Description:
A firmware repository enables you to store firmware bundles and deploy them across your environment.  An externally managed HTTP/HTTPS web server can be added to the appliance as a repository. It is a user-maintained HTTP/HTTPS web server. You can upload firmware bundles in a specific directory and then register the HTTP/HTTPS server with HPE OneView. This functionality is supported for Linux and Windows systems.

The recommended types of external web servers to use with the repository follow:

    * Apache
    * Internet Information Services (IIS)

NOTE: Only one external repository can be added.

Parameters.Name: Name
Parameters.Description: Provide a name for the repository.

Parameters.Name: Hostname
Parameters.Description: Specify IPv4 Address or FQDN of the target web server.

Parameters.Name: Directory
Parameters.Description: Specify the parent virtual directory where the baseline components will be kept.  Baseline components can be nested within sub directories.

Parameters.Name: Credential
Parameters.Description: Provide a PSCredential object if the target web server requires authentication.  By default, HTTPS will be used and basic authentication is used to communicate with the target web server.

Parameters.Name: Username
Parameters.Description: Provide the username to authenticate to the target web server with if required.

Parameters.Name: Password
Parameters.Description: Provide the password of the username using a System.Security.SecureString.

Parameters.Name: Http
Parameters.Description: Use to override the default HTTPS protocol used to communicate with the target web server.  If this parameter is not used, you must specify the Base64 Certificate of the target web server.  If you use this parameter, all authentication requests will be sent as clear text.

Parameters.Name: Certificate
Parameters.Description: The Base64 Certificate of the target web server.  Must be specified if the -HTTP parameter is not used.

Parameters.Name: Async
Parameters.Description: Use this parameter to immediately return the async task.  By default, the Cmdlet will wait for the task to complete.

Parameters.Name: ApplianceConnection
Parameters.Description: Specify one or more [HPEOneView.Appliance.Connection] object(s) or Name property value(s).

Parameters.Name: NFSPath
Parameters.Description: Specify the NFS path for Superdome Flex RMC firmware updates.

InputTypes.Value: None.  You cannot pipe objects to this Cmdlet.

ReturnValues.Text: The async task for the caller to monitor.
Multiple async task resource objects.

Examples.Title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
Examples.Description: Create an external repository using a PSCredential object.

Examples.Title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 2 --------------------------
Examples.Description: Configure an external repository using anonymous authentication, and HTTP protocol.

Contents.Synopsis: Add a new Directory for Authentication
Contents.Description: This Cmdlet will create a new Directory for appliance authentication.  HPE OneView currently supports either Active Directory or LDAP (e.g. OpenLDAP) for user authentication.  The New-OVLdapServer Cmdlet is used to assist defining directory servers address, public SSL certificate and LDAP over SSL TCP port.

Parameters.Name: Name
Parameters.Description: Directory name to add.  Does not need to match LDAP/AD Directory Name, but should.

Parameters.Name: AD
Parameters.Description: Using Active Directory, which sets the authProtocol to AD and userNameField to CN

Parameters.Name: OpenLDAP
Parameters.Description: Using LDAP (i.e. OpenLDAP), which sets the authProtocol to LDAP and userNameField to UID

Parameters.Name: BaseDN
Parameters.Description: Directory Base DN (E.g. dc=domian,dc=local)

Parameters.Name: OrganizationalUnits
Parameters.Description:
OpenLDAP OU"s to begin search for Directory Group and User Account authentication.
E.g. ou=admins,ou=contoso

Parameters.Name: Servers
Parameters.Description:
Array of Directory Servers and their settings.  Must include the following:

    * Server Name (FQDN or IP)
    * Public SSL Certificate
    * SSL Port, if not default 636

Parameters.Name: Username
Parameters.Description: Directory Username to authenticate with.

Parameters.Name: Password
Parameters.Description: Directory Username password.

Parameters.Name: ApplianceConnection
Parameters.Description: Specify one or more [HPEOneView.Appliance.Connection] object(s) or Name property value(s).

Parameters.Name: Credential
Parameters.Description: Use this parameter if you want to provide a PSCredential object instead.

Parameters.Name: ServiceAccount
Parameters.Description: Use to indicate the provided credential is a Service Account.  Required for when configuring an Active Directory auth directory for two-factor authentication.

Parameters.Name: UserNamingAttribute
Description: Specify the naming attribute for OpenLDAP directories.  Allowed values:
* CN
* UID
Default Value: CN

InputTypes.Text: Account Password that will be used to validate the directory

ReturnValues.Text: Configured Authentication Directory
Multiple configured Authentication Directories

Examples.Title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 1 --------------------------
Examples.Description: Add a new directory with two directory servers, and be prompted for your directory account password.

Examples.Title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 2 --------------------------
Examples.Description: Add a new Active Directory authentication directory, using SRV domain name, and specify to use the account as a service account.

Contents.Synopsis: Add a new Directory Group to appliance.
Contents.Description: This Cmdlet provides the ability to add a new Directory Group to the appliance.  You can use the Show-OVLdapGroups to retrieve a list of avialable Directory Groups from the specified Directory.

Parameters.Name: Directory
Parameters.Description: LDAP/Active Directory Domain object.

Parameters.Name: Group
Parameters.Description: Directroy Group to add.  Can either be a string value of a Cononical Name of directory group, or object from Show-OVLdapGroups.

Parameters.Name: Roles
Parameters.Description:
The role(s) to assign to the Directroy Group, in System.Collections.ArrayList format.  Accepted values are noted within the ApplianceRoles property of the HPEOneView.Appliance.Connection object stored in the $Global:ConnectedSessions variable.

Example: $roles = "Server administrator","Network administrator"

Parameters.Name: Username
Parameters.Description:
Warning: This parameter is now obsolete.  Please transition to using the -Credential parameter.

Directory Username to authenticate with

Parameters.Name: Password
Parameters.Description:
Warning: This parameter is now obsolete.  Please transition to using the -Credential parameter.

Directory User account password.  Can be System.String or System.Security.SecureString object.

Parameters.Name: ApplianceConnection
Parameters.Description: Specify one or more [HPEOneView.Appliance.Connection] object(s) or Name property value(s).

Parameters.Name: Credential
Parameters.Description: Use this parameter if you want to provide a PSCredential object instead.

Parameters.Name: ScopePermissions
Parameters.Description:
Array collection of Hashtable<Role; Scope>.

Example: -ScopePermissions @{Role = "Network administrator"; Scope = (Get-OVScope -Name CorpNetAdmins -ErrorAction Stop) }

InputTypes.Text: The external authentication directory object from -Get-OVLdapDirectory.

ReturnValues.Text: New LDAP Group object with role assignment(s)

Examples.Description: Add "MY Directory Group1" from Domain1 with Server Administrator role and prompt for password for group validation.

# Create the directory group resource on the appliance, and associate with the SBAC permissions.
Examples.Description: Add the new directory group with specific scope permissions, and using a PSCredential object for authentication directory validation.
